label: DXL Event Example
info:
This sample demonstrates how send and receive `Event` messages from the DXL
fabric from Node-RED. The payload in the `Event` message received from the DXL
fabric is printed to the Node-RED `debug` tab.

### Prerequisites

Prior to loading this sample, make sure that you have completed the completed
the client configuration prerequisites in the
[configuration example](https://github.com/opendxl/node-red-contrib-dxl/wiki/Client-Configuration).

### Running the Sample

1. To deploy the flow, press the `Deploy` button in the upper-right corner
   of the screen. If Node-RED is able to properly connect to the DXL fabric, a
   green dot with the word `connected` should appear under each of the nodes
   which use the DXL fabric: `Send event to DXL fabric` and
   `Receive event from DXL fabric`.

1. To exercise the flow, double-click the button on the left side of the
   `Set 'hello' payload for event` node.

### Output

The following output should appear in the Node-RED `debug` tab:

~~~
"hello"
~~~

### Nodes in the Sample Flow

The flow exercises the nodes below.

#### Set 'hello payload for event'

This is an `inject` input node which starts the flow. This node injects the
text "hello" as the message `payload`. 

#### Send event to DXL fabric

This is a `dxl event publisher` output node. This node connects to the DXL
fabric and sends a DXL `Event` message with the configured topic,
"/isecg/sample/basicevent". The event message contains the `payload` set by the
`Set 'hello payload for event'` node.

#### Receive event from DXL fabric

This is a `dxl event receiver` input node. This node connects to the DXL fabric and
registers to receive events sent to the configured topic,
"/isecg/sample/basicevent". When an event is received, a message containing
the `payload` from the event is injected as a message into a new flow.

The `Payload type` field is set to "a UTF-8 string" to indicate that the payload
for the event should be set into the flow message as a UTF-8 string decoded from
the raw binary payload in the event message.

#### Output payload from event

This is a `debug` output node. This node outputs the `payload` from
the message injected by the `Receive event from DXL fabric` node.
